assetIdentification.assetDescription: Provides audio streaming and file playback capabilities for entertainment content

methodology.name: ISO21434 Risk Assessment
methodology.description: Combination of impact rating from Impact Analysis and attack feasibility from Threat Scenarios to determine cybersecurity risk

risks.title: Audio Volume Manipulation Risk
risks.description: Risk of an attacker manipulating the audio volume to produce sudden extreme sounds that could startle the driver

impactRating.justification: Potential for driver distraction and momentary loss of control, though unlikely to cause severe accidents

attackFeasibilityRating.justification: Requires specialized knowledge and vehicle access, but manipulation itself is straightforward once access is obtained

riskRating.justification: The combination of Moderate impact and Medium attack feasibility results in a Medium risk rating according to the risk matrix

riskTreatment.acceptanceCriteria: Risk must be reduced to Low or lower through implementation of security controls

treatmentOptions.description: Implement hardware volume limiting to prevent extreme volume levels
Add authentication for volume control commands
Implement rate limiting for volume changes

residualRisk.justification: Hardware volume limiting will reduce the potential impact of volume manipulation attacks, while rate limiting will increase the difficulty of causing sudden volume changes

risks.title: Malicious Media File Execution Risk
risks.description: Risk of an attacker executing arbitrary code through specially crafted media files

impactRating.justification: Potential for complete system compromise with significant financial, operational, privacy, and reputational impacts

attackFeasibilityRating.justification: Requires sophisticated knowledge of media format vulnerabilities and user interaction to play the malicious file

riskRating.justification: The combination of Severe impact and Medium attack feasibility results in a High risk rating according to the risk matrix

riskTreatment.acceptanceCriteria: Risk must be reduced to Medium or lower through implementation of security controls

treatmentOptions.description: Implement sandboxed media playback with limited privileges
Add robust input validation for all media file formats
Implement memory protection mechanisms (ASLR, DEP, etc.)
Add digital signature verification for media content

residualRisk.justification: Implementation of selected treatments will significantly reduce attack feasibility without changing impact

risks.title: Media Subsystem Denial of Service Risk
risks.description: Risk of an attacker rendering the media playback system unavailable through resource exhaustion attacks

impactRating.justification: Loss of entertainment functionality with minimal safety implications and limited financial impact

attackFeasibilityRating.justification: Relatively simple to create resource-intensive media files, though user interaction is needed to initiate playback

riskRating.justification: The combination of Minor impact and Medium attack feasibility results in a Low risk rating according to the risk matrix

riskTreatment.acceptanceCriteria: Risk can be accepted if security controls are implemented as part of good practice

treatmentOptions.description: Implement resource quotas for media playback processes
Add media file size and complexity validation
Implement automatic recovery for media subsystem failures

residualRisk.justification: Implementation of selected treatments will both reduce attack feasibility and impact through automatic recovery capabilities

securityControls.description: Implement hardware-based volume limiting circuit to prevent extreme volume levels

securityControls.title: Volume Change Rate Limiting
securityControls.description: Implement software rate limiting for volume change operations

securityControls.title: Media Playback Sandboxing
securityControls.description: Implement sandboxed environment for media playback with restricted privileges

securityControls.title: Media File Format Validation
securityControls.description: Implement robust validation of all media file formats before processing

securityControls.title: Memory Protection Mechanisms
securityControls.description: Implement ASLR, DEP, and other memory protection mechanisms

securityControls.title: Media Process Resource Quotas
securityControls.description: Implement CPU, memory, and I/O resource quotas for media playback processes

securityControls.title: Media File Size and Complexity Validation
securityControls.description: Implement validation of media file size and complexity metrics before processing

securityControls.title: Automatic Media Subsystem Recovery
securityControls.description: Implement watchdog and automatic recovery mechanisms for media subsystem failures

keyTerms.Sandboxing: Security mechanism that provides isolated environment for untrusted programs

contentSummary: Risk assessment for Media Playback System analyzing three key risks: audio volume manipulation (RA-MEDIA-01, Medium risk), malicious media file execution (RA-MEDIA-02, High risk), and media subsystem denial of service (RA-MEDIA-03, Low risk). Assessment combines impact ratings from impact analysis and attack feasibility from threat scenarios. Risk treatment involves 8 security controls including hardware volume limiting, volume change rate limiting, media playback sandboxing, file format validation, memory protection mechanisms, resource quotas, file complexity validation, and automatic recovery mechanisms. Implementation of these controls is estimated to reduce risks to acceptable levels (Medium or Low), addressing key security requirements for media playback functionality.
